title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 1. (1) This Order may be cited as the Broadcasting Act 2009 (Section 21)
text_raw:
1. (1) This Order may be cited as the Broadcasting Act 2009 (Section 21) 

Levy Order 2024. 

(2) This Order comes into operation on the 1 May 2024. 

(3) The Broadcasting Act 2009 (Section 21) Levy Order 2023 (S.I. No. 657 
of 2023) is revoked as and from 1 May 2024. Notwithstanding the revocation 
of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (Section 21) Levy Order 2023 (S.I. No. 657 of 
2023) under this Order, any notices that have been served by the Commission 
under article 10 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (Section 21) Levy Order 2023 
(S.I. No. 657 of 2023) shall remain valid and in full effect and all payments due 
pursuant to invoices issued by the Commission under such article 10 notices 
shall remain enforceable.
text_norm: 1 (1) order may cited broadcasting act 2009 (section 21) levy order 2024 (2) order come operation 1 may 2024 (3) broadcasting act 2009 (section 21) levy order 2023 (s.i no 657 2023) revoked 1 may 2024 notwithstanding revocation broadcasting act 2009 (section 21) levy order 2023 (s.i no 657 2023) order notice served commission article 10 broadcasting act 2009 (section 21) levy order 2023 (s.i no 657 2023) shall remain valid full effect payment due pursuant invoice issued commission article 10 notice shall remain enforceable

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 2. (1) In this Order, including the schedules unless it is otherwise
text_raw:
2. (1) In this Order, including the schedules unless it is otherwise 

indicated- 

“Act of 2009” means the Broadcasting Act 2009; 

“date of default” means the date on which a provider fails to pay to the 
Commission a sum which is payable to it under this Order; 

“levy” means a levy imposed by this Order; 

“levy period” means the period of eight (8) months commencing on the 1 May 
2024 and concluding on the 31 December 2024; 

“overdue sum” means a sum payable to the Commission under this Order 
which a provider has not paid and which remains outstanding; 

“qualified person” means a person who is qualified for appointment as auditor 
of a company under section 468(6) of the Companies Act 2014 as amended; 

“qualifying income” means income so described in Schedule 7 and Schedule 8; 

“provider” means a provider, falling within one or more of the categories of 
providers set out in Schedule 1, who must pay a levy by virtue of a decision 
made by the Commission pursuant to section 21(1) of the Act of 2009; 

“three-month Euribor” means the Euro Interbank Offered Rate with a maturity 
date of three months as advertised by the Euribor EBF Secretariat; 

“VAT” means the tax provided for in the Value-Added Tax Act 1972 (as 
amended). 

(2) In this Order including the schedules unless it is otherwise indicated— 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 30th April, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [175] 3 

(a) 

a word or expression defined in the Act of 2009 shall have the 

same meaning when used in this Order; 

(b) 

(c) 

(d) 

(e) 

a reference to legislation is a reference to that legislation as 
amended from time to time; 

a reference to an article or schedule is to an article of or 
schedule to this Order; 

a reference to a sub-article is to the sub-article of the provision 
in which the reference occurs unless it is indicated that a 
reference to another provision is intended; and 

a reference in a schedule to a paragraph is to a paragraph in the 
schedule in which the reference appears unless it is indicated 
that a reference to another provision is intended.

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 4. (1) A levy is hereby imposed on providers in respect of the levy period
text_raw:
4. (1) A levy is hereby imposed on providers in respect of the levy period 

in which the providers are in operation as such. 

(2) For the removal of doubt, a levy is hereby imposed on a provider in 
respect of the levy period in which it is in operation as such, notwithstanding 
that it has not been in operation as such for all of the levy period.
text_norm: 4 (1) levy hereby imposed provider respect levy period provider operation such (2) removal doubt levy hereby imposed provider respect levy period operation notwithstanding operation levy period

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 5. The Commission shall seek to ensure that the amount of any levy
text_raw:
5. The Commission shall seek to ensure that the amount of any levy 
imposed on providers in respect of the levy period shall be sufficient to meet 
the Commission’s expenses properly incurred and its working capital 
requirements in the levy period, in so far as those expenses and requirements 
are not met in any other way.
text_norm: 5 commission shall seek ensure amount levy imposed provider respect levy period shall sufficient meet commission expense properly incurred working capital requirement levy period far expense requirement met way

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 6. The Commission shall have different methods for calculating the
text_raw:
6. The Commission shall have different methods for calculating the 
applicable levy for each category of provider in accordance with the 
methodologies for the relevant providers set out in Schedule 2, Schedule 3, 
Schedule 4, Schedule 5 and Schedule 6 as applicable.
text_norm: 6 commission shall different method calculating applicable levy category provider accordance methodology relevant provider set schedule 2 schedule 3 schedule 4 schedule 5 schedule 6 applicable

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 7. Having determined that a provider must pay a levy in respect of the
text_raw:
7. Having determined that a provider must pay a levy in respect of the 

levy period the Commission shall determine— 

(1) the amount of such levy in accordance with the methodologies for the 
relevant providers set out in Schedule 2, Schedule 3, Schedule 4, Schedule 5 
and Schedule 6 as applicable; and 

(2) either that such levy is to be paid in one sum on or before a specified 

date, or that it is to be paid by way of instalments. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [175]
text_norm: 7 determined provider must pay levy respect levy period commission shall determine-- (1) amount levy accordance methodology relevant provider set schedule 2 schedule 3 schedule 4 schedule 5 schedule 6 applicable (2) either levy paid one sum specified date paid way instalment 4 175

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 8. Where, pursuant to article 7(2), the levy is to be paid by a provider in
text_raw:
8. Where, pursuant to article 7(2), the levy is to be paid by a provider in 
instalments, the Commission shall determine the amount of each such 
instalment and the date upon which it is to be paid.

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 9. The Commission shall serve a notice on each provider setting out—
text_raw:
9. The Commission shall serve a notice on each provider setting out— 

(1) the amount of the levy which it must pay; 

(2) where such amount is to be paid in one sum, the date on which such 

payment is to be made; and 

(3) where such amount is to be paid by way of a number of instalments, the 

amount of each such instalment and the date on which it is to be paid.
text_norm: 9 commission shall serve notice provider setting out-- (1) amount levy must pay (2) amount paid one sum date payment made (3) amount paid way number instalment amount instalment date paid

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 10. A provider on which a notice has been served pursuant to article 9 shall
text_raw:
10. A provider on which a notice has been served pursuant to article 9 shall

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 11. A provider which is obliged to make a payment of a levy to the
text_raw:
11. A provider which is obliged to make a payment of a levy to the 
Commission shall make such payment by electronic funds transfer to the bank 
account which the Commission has by way of notice in writing to the provider 
specified for such purpose. Where a provider has initiated an electronic funds 
transfer, it shall promptly notify the Commission of the date on which such 
transfer was initiated, the amount which is to be transferred and the name of 
the bank which is to effect the transfer.
text_norm: 11 provider obliged make payment levy commission shall make payment electronic fund transfer bank account commission way notice writing provider specified purpose provider initiated electronic fund transfer shall promptly notify commission date transfer initiated amount transferred name bank effect transfer

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 12. Subject to article 13, the Commission may, by way of notice in writing,
text_raw:
12. Subject to article 13, the Commission may, by way of notice in writing, 
require that a provider provide to the Commission on or before a date specified 
in such notice and in such manner as may be prescribed by the Commission — 

(1) accounts for any financial period as specified by the Commission; 

(2) a statement showing its qualifying income within any such financial 

period; and/or 

(3) a statement showing the average monthly users within any such 

financial period.
text_norm: 12 subject article 13 commission may way notice writing require provider provide commission date specified notice manner may prescribed commission -- (1) account financial period specified commission (2) statement showing qualifying income within financial period (3) statement showing average monthly user within financial period

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 13. (1) Such accounts as are referred to in sub-article 12 (1) shall be
text_raw:
13. (1) Such accounts as are referred to in sub-article 12 (1) shall be 

audited by a qualified person. 

(2) Such statement as is referred to in sub-article 12 (2) shall be 
accompanied by a certificate in support of such statement from the person who 
has audited such accounts.
text_norm: 13 (1) account referred sub-article 12 (1) shall audited qualified person (2) statement referred sub-article 12 (2) shall accompanied certificate support statement person audited account

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 15. A provider shall retain, for the period determined in accordance with
text_raw:
15. A provider shall retain, for the period determined in accordance with 

article 16— 

(1) records relevant to the preparation of accounts in accordance with 

article 12(1); and 

(2) records relevant to the preparation of a statement in accordance with 

article 12(2) and/or 12(3); and 

(3) such other records as may be prescribed by the Commission by way of 

a notice in writing served on the provider.

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 16. (1) Where a provider is obliged, under article 15, to retain a record
text_raw:
16. (1) Where a provider is obliged, under article 15, to retain a record 
which relates to one financial period only, it shall retain such record for six 
years from the end of such financial period. 

(2) Where a provider is obliged, under article 15, to retain a record which 
relates to more than one financial period, it shall retain such record for six 
years from the end of the latest period to which such record relates.
text_norm: 16 (1) provider obliged article 15 retain record relates one financial period shall retain record six year end financial period (2) provider obliged article 15 retain record relates one financial period shall retain record six year end latest period record relates

specified date or dates to inspect records held by it or by any person on its 
behalf which are relevant to the calculation and payment of a levy for the levy 
period.

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 20. Subject to article 21, the Commission may by way of notice in writing
text_raw:
20. Subject to article 21, the Commission may by way of notice in writing 

require a provider to provide to the Commission within a specified period— 

(1) copies of records held by it, or by any person on its behalf, which are 

relevant to the calculation and payment of levy for the levy period; and/or 

(2) replies to such queries concerning its activities as the Commission may 

have incorporated in such notice.

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 23. Subject to article 24, interest shall accrue on an overdue sum from the
text_raw:
23. Subject to article 24, interest shall accrue on an overdue sum from the 
date of default until the date of payment at an annual rate of 2% over threemonth Euribor.
text_norm: 23 subject article 24 interest shall accrue overdue sum date default date payment annual rate 2 threemonth euribor

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 24. The three-month Euribor rate which is applicable for the purpose of
text_raw:
24. The three-month Euribor rate which is applicable for the purpose of 
article 23 shall be the three-month Euribor rate on the date of default, provided 
that thereafter the Commission may, at three-month intervals, substitute for 
such rate the then applicable three-month Euribor rate.
text_norm: 24 three-month euribor rate applicable purpose article 23 shall three-month euribor rate date default provided thereafter commission may three-month interval substitute rate applicable three-month euribor rate

heading: 25. The Commission shall, where applicable, include in any notice
text_raw:
25. The Commission shall, where applicable, include in any notice 
requiring the payment of a levy, details of the VAT which the provider must 
pay in respect of such levy.
text_norm: 25 commission shall applicable include notice requiring payment levy detail vat provider must pay respect levy

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 26. Any surplus of income, from levies imposed under this Order, in excess
text_raw:
26. Any surplus of income, from levies imposed under this Order, in excess 
of the expenses properly incurred by the Commission and its working capital 
requirements in the levy period shall be deemed to be monies derived through 
the imposition of a levy for the levy period and shall either: 

(1) be retained by the Commission to be offset proportionately against levy 
obligations of the relevant providers on whom the levy concerned was imposed 
for the subsequent levy period; or 

(2) be refunded proportionately to the relevant providers on whom the levy 

concerned was imposed.
text_norm: 26 surplus income levy imposed order excess expense properly incurred commission working capital requirement levy period shall deemed monies derived imposition levy levy period shall either (1) retained commission offset proportionately levy obligation relevant provider levy concerned imposed subsequent levy period (2) refunded proportionately relevant provider levy concerned imposed

heading: 27. The Commission shall consider any applications by providers for a
text_raw:
27. The Commission shall consider any applications by providers for a 

review of any of the levies that are imposed under this Order. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [175] 7
text_norm: 27 commission shall consider application provider review levy imposed order 175 7

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: Categories of Providers who must pay a Levy
text_raw:
SCHEDULE 1 

Categories of Providers who must pay a Levy 

In accordance with section 21 of the Act of 2009, this Order is applicable to the 
following providers: 

(1) Providers of audiovisual media services; 

(2) Providers of sound broadcasting services; and 

(3) Providers of designated online services. 

 
 
 
 8 [175] 

Calculation of the Levy for television programme service providers
text_norm: schedule 1 category provider must pay levy accordance section 21 act 2009 order applicable following provider (1) provider audiovisual medium service (2) provider sound broadcasting service (3) provider designated online service 8 175 calculation levy television programme service provider

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 4. Television programme service providers whose base period qualifying
text_raw:
4. Television programme service providers whose base period qualifying 

income is not more than €333,333.33 are not obliged to pay a levy.
text_norm: 4 television programme service provider whose base period qualifying income eur333 333.33 obliged pay levy

heading: 5. Community broadcasters are not obliged to pay a levy.

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 6. Television programme service providers holding content provision
text_raw:
6. Television programme service providers holding content provision 
contracts pursuant to section 71 of the Act of 2009 shall pay a levy in 
accordance with Schedule 4 in respect of services provided pursuant to section 
71 of the Act of 2009.
text_norm: 6 television programme service provider holding content provision contract pursuant section 71 act 2009 shall pay levy accordance schedule 4 respect service provided pursuant section 71 act 2009

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 7. A television programme service provider whose base period qualifying
text_raw:
7. A television programme service provider whose base period qualifying 
income is more than €333,333.33 must, in respect of the levy period, pay a levy 
which is computed by reference to its base period qualifying income in 
accordance with the following table— 

 
 
 
 
 [175] 9 

Base period qualifying income 

Percentage Levy 

€1 to €666,666 

B % 

€666,667 to €6,666,666 

(B — .25) % 

€6,666,667 to €13,333,333 

(B — .50) % 

€13,333,334 to €30,000,000 

(B — .75) % 

Over €30,000,000 

(B — 1.75) %

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 8. The table in paragraph 7 shall be applied so that, for example,—
text_raw:
8. The table in paragraph 7 shall be applied so that, for example,— 

(a) 

(b) 

a levy payer whose base period qualifying income is not more 
than €666,666 must, in the levy period, pay a levy which is 
equal to B % of its base period qualifying income; and 

a levy payer whose base period qualifying income is more than 
€666,666 but is not more than €6,666,666 must, in the levy 
period, pay a levy which is equal to the aggregate of B % of the 
first €666,666 of its base period qualifying income and (B — 
.25) % of its base period qualifying income over €666,666.
text_norm: 8 table paragraph 7 shall applied example -- (a) (b) levy payer whose base period qualifying income eur666 666 must levy period pay levy equal b base period qualifying income levy payer whose base period qualifying income eur666 666 eur6 666 666 must levy period pay levy equal aggregate b first eur666 666 base period qualifying income (b -- 25) base period qualifying income eur666 666

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 9. When the Commission has sufficient information to enable it to
text_raw:
9. When the Commission has sufficient information to enable it to 
estimate the qualifying income of each levy payer for the base year, it shall 
attribute a numerical value to B for the levy period such that the levy imposed 
in respect of the levy period shall meet the expenses properly incurred and the 
Commission’s working capital requirements, in the levy period, by the 
Commission in the performance of its functions, in so far as those expenses and 
requirements are not met in any other way.

text_raw:

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 13. An entity which has generated qualifying income from operating as a
text_raw:
13. An entity which has generated qualifying income from operating as a 
television programme service provider in the base year shall pay a levy in the 
levy period even if it has ceased to be a television programme service provider 
before the levy period begins. 

 
 
 10 [175] 

Calculation of the Levy for sound broadcasting services providers

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
text_raw: SCHEDULE 3
text_norm: schedule 3

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: In this schedule—
text_raw:
1. 

In this schedule— 

“C” means the numerical value which, when expressed as a percentage, 
represents the rate at which base period qualifying income of €1 to €666,666 is 
to be levied, as contemplated in the template; 

“base period qualifying income” shall be such amount as equates to two-thirds 
of the qualifying income of sound broadcasting service providers in the base 
year; 

“base year” means the calendar year of 1 January 2022 to 31 December 2022 
or, where a sound broadcasting service provider has been in operation for part 
only of that calendar year, such part of that calendar year; 

“community broadcaster” means a person holding a contract under sections 64 
or 68(1)(b) of the Act of 2009; 

“complete table” means the table referred to in paragraph 10; 

“institutional broadcaster” means a person holding a contract under section 
68(2) of the Act of 2009; 

“levy” means the levy calculated in accordance with this schedule; 

“levy payer” means a sound broadcasting service provider who must pay a 
levy. 

"sound broadcasting service provider” means a provider of a service, within the 
meaning of Articles 56 and 57 of the Treaty on the Functioning of the 
European Union, where— 

(a) 

(b) 

the principal purpose of the service is devoted to providing 
sound programmes, by electronic communications networks, to 
the general public, under its own editorial responsibility, in 
order to inform, entertain or educate, and 

the service is provided for simultaneous or near-simultaneous 
listening to sound programmes on the basis of a programme 
schedule; 

“template” means the table set out in paragraph 7; 

“temporary broadcaster” means a person holding a contract under section 
68(1)(a) of the Act of 2009.

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 7. A sound broadcasting service provider whose base period qualifying
text_raw:
7. A sound broadcasting service provider whose base period qualifying 
income is more than €333,333.33 must, in respect of the levy period, pay a levy 
which is computed by reference to its base period qualifying income in 
accordance with the following table- 

Base period qualifying income 

Percentage Levy 

€1 to €666,666 

C % 

€666,667 to €6,666,666 

(C — .25) % 

€6,666,667 to €13,333,333 

(C — .50) % 

€ 13,333,334 to €30,000,000 

(C — .75) % 

Over €30,000,000 

(C — 1.75) %
text_norm: 7 sound broadcasting service provider whose base period qualifying income eur333 333.33 must respect levy period pay levy computed reference base period qualifying income accordance following table- base period qualifying income percentage levy eur1 eur666 666 c eur666 667 eur6 666 666 (c -- 25) eur6 666 667 eur13 333 333 (c -- 50) eur 13 333 334 eur30 000 000 (c -- 75) eur30 000 000 (c -- 1.75)

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 8. The table in paragraph 7 shall be applied so that, for example,—
text_raw:
8. The table in paragraph 7 shall be applied so that, for example,— 

(a) 

(b) 

a levy payer whose base period qualifying income is not more 
than €666,666 must, in the levy period, pay a levy which is 
equal to B % of its base period qualifying income; and 

a levy payer whose base period qualifying income is more than 
€666,666 but is not more than €6,666,666 must, in the levy 
period, pay a levy which is equal to the aggregate of C % of the 
first €666,666 of its base period qualifying income and (C — 
.25) % of its base period qualifying income over €666,666.
text_norm: 8 table paragraph 7 shall applied example -- (a) (b) levy payer whose base period qualifying income eur666 666 must levy period pay levy equal b base period qualifying income levy payer whose base period qualifying income eur666 666 eur6 666 666 must levy period pay levy equal aggregate c first eur666 666 base period qualifying income (c -- 25) base period qualifying income eur666 666

text_raw:

attribute a numerical value to C for the levy period such that the levy imposed 
in respect of the levy period shall meet the expenses properly incurred and the 
Commission’s working capital requirements, in the levy period, by the 
Commission in the performance of its functions, in so far as those expenses and 
requirements are not met in any other way.

text_raw:

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 3. Where a content provision contract holder has already paid a fee to the
text_raw:
3. Where a content provision contract holder has already paid a fee to the 
Commission in advance of entering into a content provision contract and where 
such fee exceeds the amount of any levy to be imposed under this schedule, the 
Commission shall refund so much of the relevant fee paid as exceeds the 
amount of any levy to be imposed under this schedule.

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 2. The levy which a designated online service provider must pay in the
text_raw:
2. The levy which a designated online service provider must pay in the 
levy period shall be based on the sum of the average number of users per each 
individual designated online service provider in the base period. Such figures 
shall be published by each individual designated online service provider each 
six months in accordance with Article 24(2) of the Digital Services Act.
text_norm: 2 levy designated online service provider must pay levy period shall based sum average number user per individual designated online service provider base period figure shall published individual designated online service provider six month accordance article 24(2) digital service act

heading: 3. The average number of monthly users per each individual designated
text_raw:
3. The average number of monthly users per each individual designated 
online service provider in the base period shall be determined by the 
Commission in accordance with the figures that such designated online service 
providers are obliged to publish pursuant to Article 24(2) of the Digital 
Services Act.
text_norm: 3 average number monthly user per individual designated online service provider base period shall determined commission accordance figure designated online service provider obliged publish pursuant article 24(2) digital service act

heading: 4. A designated online service provider must in respect of the levy period
text_raw:
4. A designated online service provider must in respect of the levy period 
pay a levy which is computed by reference to the sum of the average number of 
monthly users per each individual designated online service in accordance with 
the following formula- 

𝐸 =

Estimated Costs of Regulation of Sector
Sum of Service Users across Sector

text_raw:

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: Qualifying Income of television programme service providers and sound
text_raw:
SCHEDULE 7 

Qualifying Income of television programme service providers and sound 

broadcasting service providers
text_norm: schedule 7 qualifying income television programme service provider sound broadcasting service provider

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: In this schedule—
text_raw:
1. 

In this schedule— 

“broadcasting funding scheme” means a scheme administered by the 
Commission by virtue of Part 10 of the Act of 2009, or a scheme under section 
154 of the Act of 2009; 

“Government” means the Government provided for in Bunreacht na hÉireann; 

“interactive income” means income generated by a provider from listener or 
viewer response to a broadcast including, without limitation, telephony income 
and income from online payments which are so generated; 

“non-linear service” means a service provided by a television programme 
service provider whereby a person may view or listen to programmes at the 
moment chosen by the user and at his or her individual request on the basis of a 
catalogue of programmes selected by the television programme service 
provider; 

“public body” means an entity whose decisions are subject to judicial review; 

“provider” means each provider of services set out in this Order whose levy 
shall be determined based on qualifying income.
text_norm: 1 schedule-- broadcasting funding scheme mean scheme administered commission virtue part 10 act 2009 scheme section 154 act 2009 government mean government provided bunreacht na heireann interactive income mean income generated provider listener viewer response broadcast including without limitation telephony income income online payment generated non-linear service mean service provided television programme service provider whereby person may view listen programme moment chosen user individual request basis catalogue programme selected television programme service provider public body mean entity whose decision subject judicial review provider mean provider service set order whose levy shall determined based qualifying income

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 2. Subject to paragraph 4, money which the Government or a public body
text_raw:
2. Subject to paragraph 4, money which the Government or a public body 

pays to a provider by way of grant is qualifying income of that provider.
text_norm: 2 subject paragraph 4 money government public body pay provider way grant qualifying income provider

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 3. Without limitation, money which the Minister for Tourism, Culture,
text_raw:
3. Without limitation, money which the Minister for Tourism, Culture, 
Arts, Gaeltacht, Sport and Media pays to a provider is qualifying income of 
that provider.
text_norm: 3 without limitation money minister tourism culture art gaeltacht sport medium pay provider qualifying income provider

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 4. Money which the Commission pays to a provider under a broadcasting
text_raw:
4. Money which the Commission pays to a provider under a broadcasting 

funding scheme is not qualifying income of that provider.
text_norm: 4 money commission pay provider broadcasting funding scheme qualifying income provider

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 5. Subject to paragraph 7, income of a provider from commercial
text_raw:
5. Subject to paragraph 7, income of a provider from commercial 
communications (including late payment surcharges and cancellation penalties) 
net of agent’s commission, computed on a normal accruals basis, is qualifying 
income of that provider.
text_norm: 5 subject paragraph 7 income provider commercial communication (including late payment surcharge cancellation penalties) net agent commission computed normal accrual basis qualifying income provider

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 6. Where a provider gives early payment discounts and/or volume
text_raw:
6. Where a provider gives early payment discounts and/or volume 
discounts in respect of commercial communications such discounts may be 
taken into account in computing the qualifying income of the provider.
text_norm: 6 provider give early payment discount volume discount respect commercial communication discount may taken account computing qualifying income provider

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 7. Where a provider pays commission to an agent in respect of a
text_raw:
7. Where a provider pays commission to an agent in respect of a 
commercial communication and such commission exceeds 15% of the amount 
payable to the provider by the person for whom such communication is 
broadcast, the amount by which such commission exceeds 15% may not be 
deducted in computing such provider’s qualifying income.
text_norm: 7 provider pay commission agent respect commercial communication commission exceeds 15 amount payable provider person communication broadcast amount commission exceeds 15 may deducted computing provider qualifying income

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 7. Subject to paragraph 9, where reasonable provision is made in the
text_raw:
7. Subject to paragraph 9, where reasonable provision is made in the 
audited accounts of a provider for bad debts relating to commercial 
communications, a corresponding deduction may be made in computing such a 
provider’s qualifying income. 

 
 [175] 19
text_norm: 7 subject paragraph 9 reasonable provision made audited account provider bad debt relating commercial communication corresponding deduction may made computing provider qualifying income 175 19

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 8. No such deduction, as is referred to in paragraph 8, may be made for a
text_raw:
8. No such deduction, as is referred to in paragraph 8, may be made for a 
provision for bad debts to the extent that the income to which such provision 
relates would not be qualifying income.
text_norm: 8 deduction referred paragraph 8 may made provision bad debt extent income provision relates would qualifying income

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 10. Subject to paragraphs 5 and 7, costs incurred by a provider in securing
text_raw:
10. Subject to paragraphs 5 and 7, costs incurred by a provider in securing 
commercial communications may not be deducted in computing such a 
provider’s qualifying income.
text_norm: 10 subject paragraph 5 7 cost incurred provider securing commercial communication may deducted computing provider qualifying income

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 11. Where a provider receives non-cash consideration for a commercial
text_raw:
11. Where a provider receives non-cash consideration for a commercial 
communication, the qualifying income of the provider shall be increased by an 
amount equal to the Commission’s estimate of the value of such non-cash 
consideration.
text_norm: 11 provider receives non-cash consideration commercial communication qualifying income provider shall increased amount equal commission estimate value non-cash consideration

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 12. Subject to paragraph 13, where a provider generates interactive income
text_raw:
12. Subject to paragraph 13, where a provider generates interactive income 

such income is qualifying income of that provider.
text_norm: 12 subject paragraph 13 provider generates interactive income income qualifying income provider

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 13. Where a provider generates interactive income through broadcasting
text_raw:
13. Where a provider generates interactive income through broadcasting 
programmes featuring competitions, the value of prizes awarded to participants 
may be deducted in computing qualifying income, but no deduction may be 
made for the value of a prize which is provided at the cost of a third party or 
for any other costs incurred in generating interactive income.
text_norm: 13 provider generates interactive income broadcasting programme featuring competition value prize awarded participant may deducted computing qualifying income deduction may made value prize provided cost third party cost incurred generating interactive income

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 14. Notwithstanding any other provision of this schedule, income which a
text_raw:
14. Notwithstanding any other provision of this schedule, income which a 
provider earns from the provision of a non-linear service is not qualifying 
income of that provider.
text_norm: 14 notwithstanding provision schedule income provider earns provision non-linear service qualifying income provider

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 15. All qualifying income should be apportioned to the service in which it
text_raw:
15. All qualifying income should be apportioned to the service in which it 
was raised. Where such an apportionment is not possible, qualifying income 
shall be spread across all services provided by the provider based on 
percentage breakdown of apportioned qualifying income of all the services 
provided by the provider. 

 
 
 
 20 [175]
text_norm: 15 qualifying income apportioned service raised apportionment possible qualifying income shall spread across service provided provider based percentage breakdown apportioned qualifying income service provided provider 20 175

Qualifying Income of audiovisual on-demand media service providers
text_norm: schedule 8 qualifying income audiovisual on-demand medium service provider

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: In this schedule—
text_norm: 1 schedule-- broadcasting funding scheme mean scheme administered commission virtue part 10 act 2009 scheme section 154 act 2009 government mean government provided bunreacht na heireann interactive income mean income generated provider listener viewer response audiovisual on-demand medium service including without limitation income online payment generated public body mean entity whose decision subject judicial review provider mean provider service set order whose levy shall determined based qualifying income

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 2. Subject to paragraph 5, money which the Government or a public body
text_raw:
2. Subject to paragraph 5, money which the Government or a public body 

pays to a provider by way of grant is qualifying income of that provider.
text_norm: 2 subject paragraph 5 money government public body pay provider way grant qualifying income provider

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 3. Without limitation, money which Minister for Tourism, Culture, Arts,
text_raw:
3. Without limitation, money which Minister for Tourism, Culture, Arts, 
Gaeltacht, Sport and Media pays to a provider is qualifying income of that 
provider.
text_norm: 3 without limitation money minister tourism culture art gaeltacht sport medium pay provider qualifying income provider

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: Income generated by a provider from the provision of an audiovisual
text_raw:
4. 

Income generated by a provider from the provision of an audiovisual 
on-demand media service, including all income relating to the provision of 
such service including (but not limited to) public funding and/or income from 
subscriptions, transactions (including pay-per-view, rental and purchase of 
programmes) and/or advertising is qualifying income of that provider.
text_norm: 4 income generated provider provision audiovisual on-demand medium service including income relating provision service including (but limited to) public funding income subscription transaction (including pay-per-view rental purchase programmes) advertising qualifying income provider

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 5. Money which the Commission pays to a provider under a broadcasting
text_raw:
5. Money which the Commission pays to a provider under a broadcasting 

funding scheme is not qualifying income of that provider.
text_norm: 5 money commission pay provider broadcasting funding scheme qualifying income provider

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 6. Subject to paragraph 8, income of a provider from commercial
text_raw:
6. Subject to paragraph 8, income of a provider from commercial 
communications (including late payment surcharges and cancellation penalties) 
net of agent’s commission, computed on a normal accruals basis, is qualifying 
income of that provider.
text_norm: 6 subject paragraph 8 income provider commercial communication (including late payment surcharge cancellation penalties) net agent commission computed normal accrual basis qualifying income provider

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 7. Where a provider gives early payment discounts and/or volume
text_raw:
7. Where a provider gives early payment discounts and/or volume 
discounts in respect of commercial communications such discounts may be 
taken into account in computing the qualifying income of the provider.
text_norm: 7 provider give early payment discount volume discount respect commercial communication discount may taken account computing qualifying income provider

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 8. Where a provider pays commission to an agent in respect of a
text_raw:
8. Where a provider pays commission to an agent in respect of a 
commercial communication and such commission exceeds 15% of the amount 
payable to the provider by the person for whom such communication is 
broadcast, the amount by which such commission exceeds 15% may not be 
deducted in computing such provider’s qualifying income.
text_norm: 8 provider pay commission agent respect commercial communication commission exceeds 15 amount payable provider person communication broadcast amount commission exceeds 15 may deducted computing provider qualifying income

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 9. Subject to paragraph 10, where reasonable provision is made in the
text_raw:
9. Subject to paragraph 10, where reasonable provision is made in the 
audited accounts of a provider for bad debts relating to commercial 
communications, a corresponding deduction may be made in computing such a 
provider’s qualifying income. 

 
 [175] 21
text_norm: 9 subject paragraph 10 reasonable provision made audited account provider bad debt relating commercial communication corresponding deduction may made computing provider qualifying income 175 21

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 10. No such deduction, as is referred to in paragraph 9, may be made for a
text_raw:
10. No such deduction, as is referred to in paragraph 9, may be made for a 
provision for bad debts to the extent that the income to which such provision 
relates would not be qualifying income.
text_norm: 10 deduction referred paragraph 9 may made provision bad debt extent income provision relates would qualifying income

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 11. Subject to paragraphs 6 and 8, costs incurred by a provider in securing
text_raw:
11. Subject to paragraphs 6 and 8, costs incurred by a provider in securing 
commercial communications may not be deducted in computing such a 
provider’s qualifying income.
text_norm: 11 subject paragraph 6 8 cost incurred provider securing commercial communication may deducted computing provider qualifying income

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 12. Where a provider receives non-cash consideration for a commercial
text_raw:
12. Where a provider receives non-cash consideration for a commercial 
communication, the qualifying income of the provider shall be increased by an 
amount equal to the Commission’s estimate of the value of such non-cash 
consideration.
text_norm: 12 provider receives non-cash consideration commercial communication qualifying income provider shall increased amount equal commission estimate value non-cash consideration

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 13. Where a provider generates interactive income such income is
text_raw:
13. Where a provider generates interactive income such income is 

qualifying income of that provider. 

All qualifying income should be apportioned to the service in which it was 
raised. Where such an apportionment is not possible, qualifying income shall 
be spread across all services provided by the provider based on percentage 
breakdown of apportioned qualifying income of all the services provided by 
the provider 

GIVEN under the seal of Coimisiún na Meán, 

26 April, 2024. 

JEREMY GODFREY, 

Chairperson of Coimisiún na Meán. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 22 [175]

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This Order imposes a levy on certain specified classes of providers of 
audiovisual media service providers, providers of sound broadcasting services 
and providers of designated online services, for the purpose of meeting the 
Commission’s expenses properly incurred and its working capital requirements 
in respect of the levy period, in so far as those expenses and requirements are 
not met in any other way. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [175] 23
